intro: Cheiranthus roseus, commonly known as the common wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Cheiranthus roseus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can bloom throughout the spring and early summer.
